channel.title: CVE Feed for Wyze -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Wyze -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-37066|2024-08-02T03:43:50.813Z -- wyze -- wyze%20cam%20v4%20pro
item.description: A command injection vulnerability exists in Wyze V4 Pro firmware versions before 4.50.4.9222, which allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands over Bluetooth as root during the camera setup process.

item.title: CVE-2024-37066|2024-07-19T12:05:11.395Z -- wyze -- wyze%20cam%20v4%20pro
item.description: A command injection vulnerability exists in Wyze V4 Pro firmware versions before 4.50.4.9222, which allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands over Bluetooth as root during the camera setup process.

item.title: CVE-2023-6322|2024-06-04T17:17:13.840Z -- wyze -- cam%20v3
item.description: A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the message parsing functionality of the Roku Indoor Camera SE version 3.0.2.4679 and Wyze Cam v3 version 4.36.11.5859. A specially crafted message can lead to stack-based buffer overflow. An attacker can make authenticated requests to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2024-37066|2024-07-19T15:27:36.879Z -- wyze -- wyze%20cam%20v4%20pro
item.description: A command injection vulnerability exists in Wyze V4 Pro firmware versions before 4.50.4.9222, which allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands over Bluetooth as root during the camera setup process.
